title: Broken Windows Theory

dialogue.speaker: The Architect
dialogue.text: They're fascinating because they poke holes in the coherence you're both building and resisting.
dialogue.context: Pointing at an unfinished building with a broken window, discussing altered states

scene_context: The Architect points to an unfinished building with one broken window, using it as metaphor for how altered states affect our constructed coherence.
philosophical_theme: Altered states as disruptions to carefully maintained identity structures
visual_elements: Unfinished building with single broken window as metaphor for consciousness
